Package models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
models.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Player class exists to keep an aggregation of data associated with each player so the controller knows what Units/Tiles each player is allowed to interact with.
Author:
Luke
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addCity​(City city)
    addCity() adds a new City Object to the list of cities this player owns
    void addUnit​(Unit unit)
    addUnit() adds a new Unit Object to the list of Units this player owns
    java.util.ArrayList<City> getCities()
    getCities() returns the collection of Cities that belong to this Player for the controller
    java.lang.String getID()
    Gives access to this Player's ID/name for displaying in the View or specifying in the Controller
    java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getUnits()
    getUnits() returns the collection of Units that belong to this Player for the controller
    boolean isHuman()
    Informs the controller whether this Player is a human or a CPU
    void removeCity​(City city)
    Remove a City from this Player's City collection (for use when City dies)
    void removeUnit​(Unit unit)
    Remove a Unit from this Player's Unit collection (for use when Unit dies or Settler settles city)

    • Player

      public Player​(int isHuman, java.lang.String ID)
      Player() is our constructor that takes an int and a String and sets the appropriate fields
      Parameters:
      isHuman - int indicating whether this player is human or not
      ID - String giving the ID of this Player object.

    • getUnits

      public java.util.ArrayList<Unit> getUnits()
      getUnits() returns the collection of Units that belong to this Player for the controller
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Units this player owns.

    • getCities

      public java.util.ArrayList<City> getCities()
      getCities() returns the collection of Cities that belong to this Player for the controller
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Cities this player owns.

    • isHuman

      public boolean isHuman()
      Informs the controller whether this Player is a human or a CPU
      Returns:
      true if this player is human, false if CPU

    • removeUnit

      public void removeUnit​(Unit unit)
      Remove a Unit from this Player's Unit collection (for use when Unit dies or Settler settles city)
      Parameters:
      unit - Unit to be removed from this Player's Unit collection

    • removeCity

      public void removeCity​(City city)
      Remove a City from this Player's City collection (for use when City dies)
      Parameters:
      city - City to be removed from this Player's Unit collection

    • getID

      public java.lang.String getID()
      Gives access to this Player's ID/name for displaying in the View or specifying in the Controller
      Returns:
      a String that is this Player's ID
